data.title: signatureHelp gives buggy results when one parameter is a subset of another
Cannot Shift+Tab back to editor tab name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (40fecfaa77f01672e8a147be71f6f7ccb9cf8a12, 2017-02-27T14:09:29.088Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none

1. Tab forward through editor tabs with Voice Over
2. Notice how editor titles and close buttons are read out
3. Shift+Tab backward through editor tabs
4. Notice only the close buttons are read out

data.title: feature: allow selecting search results
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: insiders nightly

Version 1.10.0-insider
Commit 40fecfaa77f01672e8a147be71f6f7ccb9cf8a12
Date 2017-02-27T14:13:35.653Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version: Linux Mint Cinnamon 18.1 64-bit.

Feature request example:
1. search for some regex.
2. hit Ctrl+c
... all the highlighted search results are now stored as lines in the clipboard.
3. open a new document, and paste.
Result: all the search items are now shown as a list.

Bonus points addendum: Another operation to put virtual cursors in each of them, allowing for simultaneous editing.

data.title: Syntax highlighter does not escape Clojure \"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:44:55.542Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-64-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|javadebugger|donjayamanne|0.0.2|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any .clj file
2. Paste `(def characters [\a \b \c \! \" \? \[ \x \y \z])`

The end of the statement will be highlighted as if it is a string literal. However, it is not a string literal, in Clojure a backslash preceding a character overrides whatever meaning it might have otherwise and turns it into a java.lang.Character literal.

![screenshot from 2017-02-27 22 00 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3543310/23375114/35035680-fd38-11e6-9bad-c561cbe40ea8.png)

Not sure how this was added, but it would be unexpected to have that added automatically. /cc @rebornix

data.title: Git: Stage [Un]Selected Ranges doesn't truly follow the selected range
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (40fecfaa77f01672e8a147be71f6f7ccb9cf8a12, 2017-02-27T14:09:29.088Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

Before the SCM changes, staging selected lines would only stage the truly selected lines, since though it now seems to stage by hunks -- meaning if there are multiple lines changed together, as long as there is a selection range touching one of the lines, then the whole hunk is staged.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit a set of consecutive lines in a file
2. Select only 1 of the lines
3. Execute the `Git: Stage Selected Ranges` command
4. See that the entire block gets staged

data.title: “Find All References” across files for a method/function in javascript
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.9.1
- OS Version:OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Select a method in javascript
2.Right click on Find all References

Expected Result: Find all references across files in a project
Actual Result: finds references in the current file.

**Note:** The project i'm working on uses requirejs to load and utilize module dependencies.

data.title: Require cmd/ctrl+click to follow links in the terminal
data.body:
Issues with current non-ctrl system:

- Not aligned with editor (related https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21347)
- Users can accidentally open links when they want to focus the terminal or select text
- It could mess with terminal applications
- This is how most terminal emulators work

data.title: extending navigation, layout and toolbars?
data.body:
Hi,
might it be possible to add toolbars (ribbons and the like) to VSCode from within extensions ? I was checking the extension documentation but I couldn't answer this question.

I am evaluating the possibility to use VSCode as replacement for our home grown IDE and convert our application specific code into extensions just. As shown [here in the screenshots](https://github.com/xblox/xblocks-commander/issues/1), I am also wondering I can add my own tree-views to the navigation panel or replace the file-panel with our own.... 

Of course, this is not an issue. Feel free to close this here just. Its a rather a simple yes/no question. I am aware I could fork VSCode just and try to add this but I'd love to archive it via extensions (may be in the future roadmap?). 

thanks a lot,
guenter

data.title: Quick fix: select first entry by default
data.body: I think it would make some scenarios easier to type if the first suggestion of a quick fix was selected by default in the context menu. That way for many fixes all you need to type is `Cmd+.` and `Enter`.

data.title: move/rename operation with git
data.body:
If a Project is tracked by git do rename or move files and folder by git, to keep the file history.
This helps git to merge changes by the new location.

data.title: Error in HTML comment parsing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:31:51.320Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type the following HTML in VS Code:
```
<html>
    <!-- This comment parses just fine -->
    <!-- This comment is wrongly parsed and continues afterwards--->
</html>
```
2. Note the end of the second comment not being seen as an end of comment

data.title: Fix renderParameters
data.body: Closes Microsoft/vscode-go#814

data.title: Stop scrolling when there's nothing more to scroll to
data.body:
When I have an open text file and scroll all the way down to the bottom of the file the bottom line appears on the top of the editor followed by nothing.

What I suggest is that the scrolling would stop, when the last line of the file still appeared at the bottom of the editor (instead of the top).

data.title: PHP snippets not showing up. Instead, VSCode uses HTML snippets
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10, build 15031

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add any working snippet to PHP
2. Snippet won't show up

I am happy to see HTML snippets in my PHP files, but seems to me that PHP snippets are being completely ignored. Can they run alongside each other? If no, then please let us at least have PHP snippets separated from HTML.

data.title: Find (Cmd+F) and Replace (Cmd+Alt+F) non-standard behavior

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
While the current behavior is consistent, it's a bit confusing when moving back and forth from other apps that implement the find / replace in a more standard way. What I'd expect, judging from other editors I use all the time (Sublime, Xcode, Android Studio) is:
- Cmd+F opens the find dialog, collapsed to only show the find field (and not the replace field), which makes it clearer what operation you're performing
- Cmd+Alt+F opens the replace dialog, expanded showing both find and replace filed, and focuses input on the find field

data.title: After using Replace All the find/replace dialog shows "No results"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
After making a text replacement with Replace All the dialog shows "No results" in red which I think is confusing. I think the problem is the lack of feedback that the replacement took place. The "No results" is the most obvious change in the UI as a result of pressing the Replace All button and the red color reads a bit like an error while the replace actually worked as intended.

I suggest showing the number of instances replaced (like "7 replaced"). This should be reset to the normal behavior ("x of y" / "No results") as soon as the text in the find field is changed or the dialog is closed and reopened.

data.title: Syntax highlight for C code breaks with macro definition containing a function/parenthesis
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- Extensions: ms-vscode.cpptools@0.10.1
- OS Version: Fedora 25

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a basic C program with macro definition containing a function.  For example:

```c
#include <stdio.h>

#define FOO bar()

int main(void)
{
        return 0;
}
```
2. With the above code example, the syntax highlight for C code breaks, turning `main()` definition entirely blue-ish.  See:

![selection_032](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2346907/23363321/e2961a36-fcd8-11e6-8c2e-236519a2f0c4.png)

It seems that the syntax highlight motor expects a comma `;` after a pair of parenthesis is added to macro definition, correcting the colors:

![selection_033](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2346907/23363344/fcadf010-fcd8-11e6-8006-139170c84f0b.png)

data.title: MDX code style
data.body:
Would be nice to have code styling for MDX like SQL.

See also:
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MultiDimensional_eXpressions
* https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms144785.aspx

data.title: Markdown preview scrolls to top when "scroll-lock" is turned off
data.body:
Have the following settings:
```
	"markdown.preview.scrollPreviewWithEditorSelection": false,
	"markdown.preview.scrollEditorWithPreview": false,
```

**Manually** set the preview scroll position to a desired location. Type in the .md file. Observe that the preview scrolls to the top when I would expect it to stay at the scroll top I have **manually** selected.

![preview-scroll-to-top](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/23363158/87263c14-fcf9-11e6-883b-5e5aed0513c4.gif)

This is a regression from 1.9.1, where the markdown preview respects my manual set scroll position (with the same two settings):

![preview-no-scroll-1 9 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/23363258/1b7b50ac-fcfa-11e6-984b-2c6e1d00da58.gif)

Leaving at your consideration if this should be fixed for 1.10, I had to downgrade to 1.9.1 to write my release notes.
